attributes.action: Shift England (and Wales) summer holiday to span over July rather than August.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.statista.com/statistics/322658/monthly-average-daily-temperatures-in-the-united-kingdom-uk/ - this source proves that average highest temperatures occur in July

https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/uk-weather-britain-set-hottest-12676729.amp - heatwaves occuring in June and July (though some is in August, storms occur mostly here - https://www.statista.com/statistics/584914/monthly-rainfall-in-uk/ )
attributes.background: Though the highest temperatures of the year are in July, the summer holidays of England and Wales are in August. Students have to spend this time in school, instead of spending time socialising others on holiday both home and abroad. Rather than extending it, it should be moved around a month early.

rejection.details: The UK Government doesn't set school holiday dates. These are the responsibility of individual schools and local councils.
